meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to one thousandth of an inch.
meanings.sent1: The hair was so thin, it measured only a milline in width.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler needed a milline measurement to craft the delicate necklace.
meanings.sent3: I tried to measure the ant's tiny hat with a milline, but it kept moving.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was as thin as a milline thread, ready to snap at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The milline measurement was crucial for the precision of the scientific experiment.

meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter.
meanings.sent1: The fabric was so fine, it required a milline measurement for accuracy.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker needed a milline tool to ensure the exact length.
meanings.sent3: I joked that I needed a milline ruler to measure the distance to the moon.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as precise as a milline measurement, never wavering.
meanings.sent5: The milline unit was essential for the engineer to calculate the dimensions accurately.

meanings.definition: A unit of weight equal to one thousandth of a gram.
meanings.sent1: The jewelry scale could measure even a milline of weight with accuracy.
meanings.sent2: The pharmacist needed a milline scale to dispense the precise amount of medicine.
meanings.sent3: I pretended to weigh a feather using a milline scale, just for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her decision hung in the balance, as light as a milline of weight.
meanings.sent5: The milline weight was crucial for the chemist to mix the ingredients correctly.
